intro: Muretia fragrantissima, commonly known as the sweet shrub, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The fragrance of its leaves has made it a popular plant in perfumery and traditional medicine.
